Friday is a desktop app for **managing your tasks, optimzed for use via a Command Line Interace (CLI)** while still
having the benefits of a GUI. If you can type fast, Friday can help you manage your deadlines faster than ever.
1. Ensure you have Java `17` installed in your Computer.
2. Download the latest `.jar` file from here.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the _home folder_ for Friday.
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in, and use the `java -jar friday.jar` command to run
A GUI similar to the above should appear in a few seconds. Note that the app does not begin with sample data.
5. Type the command in the command box and press Enter to execute it. \
Some example commands you can try:
- `todo Homework Assignment`: Adds a Todo task with the description Homework Assignment
6. Refer to the Features below for details of each command.
> - Words in `UPPER_CASE` are the paramenters to be supplied by the user.
>   e.g. in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo Buy Milk`.
>   e.g. If a command specifies `todo DESCRIPTON`, then the user must give an input to `DESCRIPTION`.
> - Parameters labelled as `ID` must be within the list's index (1-base indexing)
> - Parameters labelled as `FORMATTED_DATE` must follow a certain DateTime format to be compared chronologically.
> See supported formats for more details.
> - Parameters **must** be in a specific order.
>   e.g if the command specifies `event DESCRIPTION /from DATE_1 /to DATE_2`, then
> `event DESCRIPTION /to DATE_2 /from DATE_1` is not valid.
> - Extraneous parameters for commands that do not take in parameters such as (`list` and `bye`) will be ignored.
>   e.g. if the command given is `list 123`, it will be interpreted as `list`.

Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
Friday data are saved in the hard disck atuomatically after any command that changes the data. There
is no need to save manually.
**Q**: How do I transfer my data to another Computer?
**A**: Install the app in the other computer and overwrite the empty data file it creates with the file
that contains the data of your previous Friday folder.

* @throws FridayException Thrown when encountering various exceptions in Command subclasses.

Event event = new Event("Project meeting", "Sep 19 2024, 2:00 pm", "Sep 19 2024, 4:00 pm");
assertEquals("[E][ ][ ] Project meeting (from: Sep 19 2024, 2:00 pm to: Sep 19 2024, 4:00 pm)", event.toString());
String eventString = "[E][ ][ ] Project meeting (from: Sep 19 2024, 2:00 pm to: Sep 19 2024, 4:00 pm)";
String eventString = "[E][H][ ] Project meeting (from: Sep 19 2024, 2:00 PM to: Sep 19 2024, 4:00 PM)";
Event event = new Event("Project meeting", "Sep 19 2024, 2:00 pm", "Sep 19 2024, 4:00 pm");
assertEquals("[E][ ][X] Project meeting (from: Sep 19 2024, 2:00 pm to: Sep 19 2024, 4:00 pm)", event.toString());
Event event = new Event("Casual meeting", "Nov 10 2024, 10:00 am", "Nov 10 2024, 12:00 pm");
assertEquals("[E][ ][ ] Casual meeting (from: Nov 10 2024, 10:00 am to: Nov 10 2024, 12:00 pm)", event.toString());
Event event = new Event("Annual review", "Nov 15 2024, 9:00 am", "Nov 15 2024, 11:00 am");
assertEquals("[E][H][ ] Annual review (from: Nov 15 2024, 9:00 am to: Nov 15 2024, 11:00 am)", event.toString());
Event event = new Event("Project meeting", "invalid-date", "Dec 02 2024, 11:00 am");
assertEquals("[E][ ][ ] Project meeting (from: invalid-date to: Dec 02 2024, 11:00 am)", event.toString());

assertTrue(todo.isDone(), "The Todo should be marked as done when [X] is present");
"The fromString method should correctly parse a Todo that is done");
assertEquals("H", todo.getPriority().toString(), "The priority should be set to HIGH");
"The fromString method should correctly parse a Todo with HIGH priority");
assertTrue(todo.isDone(), "The task should be marked as done");
"The toString method should reflect the task being done");
assertEquals("H", todo.getPriority().toString(), "The priority should be set to HIGH");
"The toString method should reflect the HIGH priority");
